channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Trump’s challenge to Fed’s independence may make gold the ‘safe haven of choice’ for investors
item.description: President Donald Trump made a move to fire a member of the Federal Reserve’s Board of Governors. Investors can see that as a threat to the political i...

item.title: Did Covid-19 push older people out of the workforce?
item.description: The answer looks obvious, but raw data can be deceiving

item.title: No one is expecting a global boom. This former hedge-fund manager says it’s coming and has a way to play it.
item.description: A global economic boom is on few radars right now. But what if it happens? The best way to play that involves an unpopular asset.

item.title: I am a 65-year old single woman with 25 credit cards. How do I cancel them without hurting my credit score?
item.description: “I pay them off each month if I use them and don’t run a balance.”

item.title: ‘My brother found God in recovery’: How do you save for retirement when ‘God will provide’ is your core value?
item.description: “Are there CFPs who are more aligned with a pragmatic, yet Christian, approach?”

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
